New Records: Marcus Semien lined a game-ending single into the left field corner to score Leody Taveras as the Texas Rangers rallied from a five-run deficit for a 6-5 win Sunday that kept the playoff-chasing Seattle Mariners from gaining ground in the AL wild card race.
Key Match Events: Semien's RBI single in the 9th inning to win the game
Leody Taveras scoring the winning run with an RBI
Mariners tied the game in the 6th inning with a throwing error and a subsequent single
Rangers tied the game in the 6th inning with a home run by Willie Langford
Mariners scored 5 runs in the 6th inning
Rangers scored 4 runs in the 6th inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Mariners were chasing a wild card spot
Bryan Woo started for the Mariners, and Andrew Heaney for the Rangers
The game was significant for both teams' playoff hopes
Post-Match Reflections: The victory kept the Mariners from gaining ground in the AL wild card race
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas
Others: The game was the third and final meeting of the series between the Mariners and Rangers
